title: Linux colrm Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the Linux colrm command to remove specific columns from a file. Explore practical examples and combine colrm with other commands for efficient text processing.

meta.title: Linux colrm Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the Linux colrm command to remove specific columns from a file. Explore practical examples and combine colrm with other commands for efficient text processing.
meta.keywords: Linux, colrm, text processing, column removal, file manipulation, command line, practical examples

verify.name: Verify the sample.txt file
verify.hint: The contents of the sample.txt file do not match the expected output after running the colrm command to remove the second and fourth columns.
